member.name: T:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.Entries
member.summary: All config entries inside

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.ConfigDefinitions
member.summary: Create a list with all config entries inside of this config file.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.GetConfigEntries
member.summary: Create an array with all config entries inside of this config file. Should be only used for metadata purposes. If you want to access and modify an existing setting then use instead with no description.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.ConfigFilePath
member.summary: Full path to the config file. The file might not exist until a setting is added and changed, or is called.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.SaveOnConfigSet
member.summary: If enabled, writes the config to disk every time a value is set. If disabled, you have to manually use or the changes will be lost!

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,BepInEx.BepInPlugin)
member.summary: Create a new config file at the specified config path.
member.param: Full path to a file that contains settings. The file will be created as needed.
If the config file/directory doesn't exist, create it immediately.
Information about the plugin that owns this setting file.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.Reload
member.summary: Reloads the config from disk. Unsaved changes are lost.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.Save
member.summary: Writes the config to disk.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.GetSetting``1(BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigDefinition)
member.summary: Access one of the existing settings. If the setting has not been added yet, null is returned. If the setting exists but has a different type than T, an exception is thrown. New settings should be added with .

member.param: Section and Key of the setting.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.GetSetting``1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Access one of the existing settings. If the setting has not been added yet, null is returned. If the setting exists but has a different type than T, an exception is thrown. New settings should be added with .

member.param: Section/category/group of the setting. Settings are grouped by this.
Name of the setting.

member.summary: Access one of the existing settings. If the setting has not been added yet, false is returned. Otherwise, true. If the setting exists but has a different type than T, an exception is thrown. New settings should be added with .

member.param: Section and Key of the setting.
The ConfigEntry value to return.

member.name: T:BepInEx.Configuration.TypeConverter
member.summary: A serializer/deserializer combo for some type(s). Used by the config system.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.TypeConverter.ConvertToString
member.summary: Used to serialize the type into a (hopefully) human-readable string. Object is the instance to serialize, Type is the object's type.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.TypeConverter.ConvertToObject
member.summary: Used to deserialize the type from a string. String is the data to deserialize, Type is the object's type, should return instance to an object of Type.

member.name: T:BepInEx.BepInPlugin
member.summary: This attribute denotes that a class is a plugin, and specifies the required metadata.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInPlugin.GUID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the plugin. Should not change between plugin versions.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInPlugin.Name
member.summary: The user friendly name of the plugin. Is able to be changed between versions.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInPlugin.Version
member.summary: The specfic version of the plugin.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInPlugin.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: The unique identifier of the plugin. Should not change between plugin versions.
The user friendly name of the plugin. Is able to be changed between versions.
The specfic version of the plugin.

member.name: T:BepInEx.BepInDependency
member.summary: This attribute specifies any dependencies that this plugin has on other plugins.

member.name: F:BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyFlags.HardDependency
member.summary: The plugin has a hard dependency on the referenced plugin, and will not run without it.

member.name: F:BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyFlags.SoftDependency
member.summary: This plugin has a soft dependency on the referenced plugin, and is able to run without it.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyGUID
member.summary: The GUID of the referenced plugin.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInDependency.Flags
member.summary: The flags associated with this dependency definition.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInDependency.MinimumVersion
member.summary: The minimum version of the referenced plugin.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInDependency.#ctor(System.String,BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyFlags)
member.summary: Marks this as depenant on another plugin. The other plugin will be loaded before this one. If the other plugin doesn't exist, what happens depends on the parameter.
member.param: The GUID of the referenced plugin.
The flags associated with this dependency definition.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInDependency.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Marks this as depenant on another plugin. The other plugin will be loaded before this one. If the other plugin doesn't exist or is of a version below , this plugin will not load and an error will be logged instead.
member.param: The GUID of the referenced plugin.
The minimum version of the referenced plugin.
member.remarks: When version is supplied the dependency is always treated as HardDependency

member.name: T:BepInEx.BepInIncompatibility
member.summary: This attribute specifies other plugins that are incompatible with this plugin.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInIncompatibility.IncompatibilityGUID
member.summary: The GUID of the referenced plugin.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInIncompatibility.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Marks this as incompatible with another plugin. If the other plugin exists, this plugin will not be loaded and a warning will be shown.
member.param: The GUID of the referenced plugin.

member.name: T:BepInEx.BepInProcess
member.summary: This attribute specifies which processes this plugin should be run for. Not specifying this attribute will load the plugin under every process.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInProcess.ProcessName
member.summary: The name of the process that this plugin will run under.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInProcess.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: The name of the process that this plugin will run under.

member.name: T:BepInEx.BuildInfoAttribute
member.summary: This class is appended to AssemblyInfo.cs when BepInEx is built via a CI pipeline. It is mainly intended to signify that the current build is not a release build and is special, like for instance a bleeding edge build.

member.summary: Logs an entry to the current logger instance.

member.name: T:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel
member.summary: The level, or severity of a log entry.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.None
member.summary: No level selected.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.Fatal
member.summary: A fatal error has occurred, which cannot be recovered from.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: An error has occured, but can be recovered from.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: A warning has been produced, but does not necessarily mean that something wrong has happened.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.Message
member.summary: An important message that should be displayed to the user.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: A message of low importance.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: A message that would likely only interest a developer.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel.All
member.summary: All log levels.

member.summary: Gets the highest log level when there could potentially be multiple levels provided.
member.param: The log level(s).

member.name: M:BepInEx.Logging.LogLevelExtensions.GetConsoleColor(BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel)
member.summary: Returns a translation of a log level to it's associated console colour.
member.param: The log level(s).
member.returns: A console color associated with the highest log level supplied.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Paths.PluginPath

The path to the plugin folder which resides in the BepInEx folder.
This is ONLY guaranteed to be set correctly when Chainloader has been initialized.
